title: Levi Strauss Stock Is Rising as Earnings Show Progress in Growth Areas
text:
Levi Strauss & Co. stock was up 2% in after-hours trading on Tuesday after the company reported slightly better-than-expected quarterly earnings that showed progress on several of the jeans-maker’s growth initiatives. It was Levi’s third earnings report since its initial public offering earlier this year.

The back story. Levi (ticker: LEVI) went public in late March, riding tailwinds of a resurgence in popularity of denim and fast-growing business lines outside of the company’s traditional men’s bottoms segment. Its...
description: Levi earned an adjusted $128 million, or 31 cents per share, in its fiscal third quarter, which ended on Aug. 25. That is down from 34 cents a share in the same period in 2018, but ahead of analysts’ consensus expectation of 28 cents in adjusted earnings per share.
